strong.em: ****Please contact your school principal or counselor if there is a need for food in your home and please leave a message if there is no answer. We will then work with each family to try and support this need. The drive thru food pick up at DMS will be discontinued due to food shortages. Please stay safe and we hope to see you soon.
****Registration for the 2020-2021 school year is now open. You may follow the following link to register https://tuscumbia.schoolmint.net/signin

p.span: Please be patient as we understand and work through some of the issues that you and our younger students are having logging in to the school issued device. We are currently working on a fix for this issue. Also, the SchoolMint app is currently not working to fidelity and we are in contact with SchoolMint in regards to this as well. If you use a computer to register, you should be able to register for next year. Tuscumbia City Schools would like to apologize and we are seeking answers for these new issues. Please be patient as we move forward with these technical issues.

If you have checked out a digital device from Tuscumbia City Schools, please review the attached document providing the rules and regulations associated with the device check-out. TCS Digital Device Checkout Form
Attention Students, Parents/Guardians/ Stakeholders

We are providing you our information regarding our Education and Support Continuity Plan. Please read and if you have any further questions or concerns, please contact your teacher first. If you are unable to contact your teacher, please contact your principal. Thank you for all that you are and have done to support Tuscumbia City Schools during this crisis. Also please be safe and follow all of the health official’s recommendations. Colbert County has been spared a large influx of coronavirus cases and with everyone's continued support of social distancing, personal hygiene, and other measures, we can protect ourselves and others. Thank you again and please read the Tuscumbia City Schools Education and Continuity Plan in the CORVID-19 section of the website or at this link. TCS Education and Continuity Plan

****Grab & go meals will be provided to all children 18 and under in the back parking lot of Deshler Middle School beginning Tuesday, April 7th from 9:30am to 11:00am. . Monday, April 13th from 9:30am to 11:00am will be the next available pick up time and will then be available each Monday following. At the time of pick up, 5 breakfast and 5 lunch meals will be provided for each child that is present. Please stay in your car and drive up to receive the meals. Reminder, children must be present in the vehicle at the time of pick-up.
Attention Parents, Guardians, and Students:

On Thursday, March 26, 2020, Alabama Governor Kay Ivey held a press conference in response to the COVID-19 pandemic that is encompassing the United States. In this press conference, Governor Ivey along with Alabama State Department of Education Superintendent Dr. Eric Mackey announced that all schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Unfortunately, this virus has created a situation where it is not feasible to safely return to school this year. All athletic events, field trips, and any other occasions are currently cancelled as well.

The Leadership Team of Tuscumbia City Schools takes this news very seriously and has already held a conference call to determine how we will proceed with the future learning of all of our students for the remainder of this school year. At the moment, beginning on April 6, 2020 each student will have educational lessons on either Edmentum, Google Classroom, or traditional paper and pencil assignment packets. We are working on a plan now to create and develop video lessons for you to access with your children. Again, this will be new material that will be in place of your child attending school. These assignments will be graded and this will determine your child’s report card grades for the last nine weeks along with yearly grades.

While this is not what we nor you understand education to be, it is our current future. We will attempt to overcome every obstacle to ensure that your child receives a quality education. As we attempt to understand and develop our future plans, please be watchful for a survey that will be sent to each of you in regards to the different technology devices that you currently have access to along with the ability to use the internet. This survey will help guide the development of our plan as we move forward.

Thank you for all you do for your children and for Tuscumbia City Schools. As we navigate our future, we need your help and support. These are very trying times for many of our stakeholders. Please remember to follow the recommendations of the Center for Disease Control and maintain social distancing, washing of hands and general hygiene, and stay home unless you need or have to go out. Everyone working together will help us get back to our normal lives quicker. Please check our website and all social media outlets for future messages.
Working for the children of Tuscumbia and our teachers daily,
Darryl Aikerson
Superintendent of Tuscumbia City Schools

strong.span: ****Registration for the 2020-2021 school year is now open. You may follow the following link to register https://tuscumbia.schoolmint.net/signin
****Please visit the COVID-19 Information link on the left side for more information.
We would like to pass along information that we have received from Helen Keller Hospital.

div.p: What to do if you suspect you have COVID-19
As always if you are experiencing a medical emergency, call 9-1-1.

If you are concerned about COVID-19, call your primary care physician or health care provider and tell them about your symptoms and exposure. They will decide whether you need to be tested, but keep in mind that there is no treatment for COVID-19 and people who are mildly ill may be able to isolate and care for themselves at home. Should your physician decide you need to be tested, they will need to call ahead and notify the hospital. You will also be asked to wear a mask upon entering the building.

p.strong: The following symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure:

div.p: Our hospitals do not test for COVID-19. We only collect samples from the persons who meet the criteria as determined by the Alabama Department of Public Health. The samples are then sent to the Alabama Department of Public Health.
· Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth
· Stay home if you feel sick- except to seek medical care
· Avoid close contact with other people- the COVID-19 virus spreads through droplets. Stay 6 feet away from people and only go into public when necessary

span.span: INVITATION FOR BIDS - Bid #20-003 Pest Control Services

span.strong: *****Due to the closure of school by the State Department of Education the Bid will be posponed to a later date. *****

div.p: Tuscumbia City Schools will be receiving sealed proposals for the above referenced service. Bids will be opened at 10:00 AM CST, on Thursday, April 2, 2020 at the Board of Education. For more information and bid documents, contact Kim Pesto, at 256-389-2900.

p.span: If you plan to attend one of the Tuscumbia City Schools in 2019-2020, you must complete this online registration process.
Documents you may need:
You have 2 options for registering:

div.p: 1. Get the Free App - using your tablet or phone. --Some find it easier to upload documents using the camera on your phone. Data charges may apply.

ul.li: The organization is Tusucmbia City Schools

span.span: 2. Online Registration - By computer or Chromebook

li.span: Click here to set your password and start the registration process Now Opened!!

ul.li: Call if you have questions or need technical assistance 1 855-957-3535

p.strong: Be sure to retain your username and password for next year!

div.p: If you need help with SchoolMint Online Registration, feel free to call our schools for questions.

p.span: NOTE: All returning students need to complete the registration process by May 1, 2020

p.strong: myschoolapps -- Online application for free and reduced lunches

p.span: Our school breakfast and lunch program is an integral part of the school day. Proper nutrition plays an important role in the success of your student. Our meal programs help students focus on daily challenges. Participating in the School Breakfast and National School Lunch Programs allows Tuscumbia City Schools to offer free or reduced-price meals to eligible students. Please click the image below to access the online form.

a.title: myschoolapps - free and reduced lunch application

span.em: Educating Students Today...Preparing Students for Tomorrow

span.style: color: #880000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;

p.span: The mission of the Tuscumbia City Schools is to provide each student with an appropriate, positive, safe, and challenging learning environment.

span.strong: *All meetings are held at Deshler High School in the Library at 5:15 pm unless otherwise noted.

strong.style: font-size: 13px; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;
font-size: 13px; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;

strong.span: The Tuscumbia City School System does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person(s) has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies:

p.span: Marsha Ricks, Special Services & 504 Coordinator (mmricks@tuscumbia.k12.al.us)

span.span: Vickey Moon, Title VI & Title IX (vhmoon@tuscumbia.k12.al.us)
303 North Commons Street East, Tuscumbia, AL 35674 (256)389-2900
